channel.title: Server Online Help Needed
channel.description: I apologize if this question has been frequently asked, or if this is the wrong section, but I desperately require help from an experienced developer or someone who knows what to do to get a server online. I've done basically all the work to my client and server that I want. Now I am ready to get others to play online with me. That is the spot at which I am stuck. Any suggestions, comments, or answers are greatly, greatly appreciated! :)

item.title: Server Online Help Needed
item.dc:creator: @The_Provoked The Provoked
item.description:
@The_Provoked wrote:

Ok, so that confirms my thoughts, but what do I change it to, exactly? My no-ip address? If so, then when I try to log in, I get the server message, “Error Connecting to Server…”

Read full topic

item.title: Server Online Help Needed
item.dc:creator: @The_Provoked The Provoked
item.description:
@The_Provoked wrote:

Thank you very much for your reply. I read and re-read the entire tutorial many times and I’ve done all those things listed. I’ve went back and rechecked all the steps to make sure they’re done and they were. My conclusion is, I have something done wrong (something in my server not set right). Wait a minute. Do I change anything in my server files (source/client) to my no-ip address? Like in the GUI.java, do I keep the “severip” to 127.0.0.1 or change it? [code]public static void main(String args[])
{
new Gui(args);

}

private Gui(String args[]) 
{
	super();
		try {

		System.out.println("connecting to update server");
		Serverip = "127.0.0.1";
		sign.signlink.startpriv(InetAddress.getByName(Serverip));
		initUI();
	} 
	catch(Exception ex)
	{
		ex.printStackTrace();
	}
}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Server Online Help Needed
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

the no-ip and in your client you put it in java text documents called client.java, gui.java, launch.java, app_sublet1.java which ever one you can find. First, thing to make it online is the portforwarding and if you have a skype or want to send teamviewer information I will try and help.

Read full topic

item.title: Server Online Help Needed
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

You may want to take a look at how to start a server in the tutorial section. It will teach you about making your server open to the public. I’m not sure about a tutorial on a client, but if you take a look at the Client Help section you may find your answers there. Best of luck to you.

Read full topic

item.description:
@The_Provoked wrote:

Which IP? The No-Ip or my computer Ip? And where in my client do I also put this Ip?

item.title: Server Online Help Needed
item.dc:creator: @Scully Scully
item.description:
@Scully wrote:

Run server. Paste IP into client. Make Advertisement thread. Release client.
